senselogic.sitevision.api.text

Interface EndecUtil


  • @Requireable(value="EndecUtil")
public interface EndecUtil
    Utility interface for encoding/decoding ("encode/decode" / "escape/unescape").

    An instance of the Sitevision class implementing this interface can be obtained via Utils.getEndecUtil(). See Utils for how to obtain an instance of the Utils interface.

    Author:
    Magnus LÃ¶vgren

    • Method Detail

      • escapeXML

        String escapeXML(String aString)
        Escapes/encodes the characters in a String using XML entities. 
           Example: "One <br /> & two" -> "One &lt;br /&gt; &amp; two"
        Parameters:
        aString - a String that needs to be escaped
        Returns:
        aString escaped

      • unEscapeXML

        String unEscapeXML(String aString)
        Unescapes/decodes a string containing basic XML entities to a string containing the actual Unicode characters corresponding to the entities.

        Supports the 5 basic XML entities (gt, lt, quot, amp, apos) and numerical unicodes (decimal and hex).

        Examples:

        [ One &lt;br /&gt; &amp; two ] will become:
        [ One <br /> & two ]

        [ &quot;Hej &aring; h&#229;&quot; &auml;r kopieringsskyddat&copy; s&#xE4;gs det ] will become:
        [ "Hej &aring; hÃ¥" &auml;r kopieringsskyddat&copy; sÃ¤gs det ]

        Parameters:
        aString - a String that contains escaped xml entities
        Returns:
        aString unescaped
        See Also:
        unEscapeHTML4(String)

      • unEscapeHTML4

        String unEscapeHTML4(String aString)
        Unescapes/decodes a string containing HTML 4 entities to a string containing the actual Unicode characters corresponding to the entities.

        Supports HTML 4.0 entities, including numerical unicodes (decimal and hex).

        Examples:

        [ One &lt;br /&gt; &amp; two ] will become:
        [ One <br /> & two ]

        [ &quot;Hej &aring; h&#229;&quot; &auml;r kopieringsskyddat&copy; s&#xE4;gs det ] will become:
        [ "Hej Ã¥ hÃ¥" Ã¤r kopieringsskyddat© sÃ¤gs det ]

        Parameters:
        aString - a String that contains escaped html 4 entities
        Returns:
        aString unescaped
        Since:
        Sitevision 2.6.2
        See Also:
        unEscapeXML(String)

      • encodeURL

        String encodeURL(String aURL)
        Encodes a String into its URL safe form using the default charset.

        Handles the www-form-urlencoded encoding scheme, also misleadingly known as URL encoding

        Parameters:
        aURL - the string to convert to a URL safe form
        Returns:
        an URL safe String. Returns null if aURL is null or can't be encoded.
        Since:
        Sitevision 2.6.1_04

      • decodeURL

        String decodeURL(String aURL)
        Decodes a URL safe String into its original form using the default charset.

        Handles the www-form-urlencoded encoding scheme, also misleadingly known as URL encoding

        Parameters:
        aURL - URL safe String to convert to its original form
        Returns:
        a decoded String. Returns null if aURL is null or can't be decoded.
        Since:
        Sitevision 2.6.1_04

      • br

        String br(String aString)
        Converts line breaks to xhtml <br /> elements. 
           Example: "Line 1\nLine 2" -> "Line 1<br />Line2"
        Parameters:
        aString - a String to convert
        Returns:
        aString the converted string

      • getBaseSubstitute

        String getBaseSubstitute(String aString)
        Replaces characters to their base subtitute. A name that is base substituted ensures that the name is CSS valid. Can for instance be used to get valid names for anchors (anchor links). 
           Example: "xml ëBå_$-1205" -> "xmleBa1205"
        Parameters:
        aString - a String that should be base substituted
        Returns:
        the base substitute for aString

      • escapeJcrName

        String escapeJcrName(String aJcrName)
        Escapes/encodes a jcr name (property name or node name) that might contain illegal characters.

        Any operation that includes a JCR name that contains illegal characters must be escaped. For example: 

        
    javax.jcr.Node node = ...

    javax.jcr.NodeIterator nodeIterator = node.getNodes("aNodeNameThatShouldBeEscaped");
    javax.jcr.NodeIterator anotherNodeIterator = node.getNodes("aNodeNameThatShouldBeEscaped/aNodeNameThatShouldBeEscaped");
    javax.jcr.Property property = node.getProperty("aPropertyNameThatShouldBeEscaped");

        Characters in JCR Names - section 3.2.5.4 of the JSR 283 specification (Java Content Repository 2.0)

        Illegal character Substitution character
        * (U+002A) "asterix" U+F02A
        / (U+002F) "slash" U+F02F
        : (U+003A) "colon" U+F03A
        [ (U+005B) "left bracket" U+F05B
        ] (U+005D) "right bracket" U+F05D
        | (U+007C) "pipe" U+F07C

        Some specific names are conflicting with the JCR naming semantics and must also be escaped:
        (though, these two "dot-only" expressions would typically be extremely uncommon as names)

        Illegal Name Substitution Name
        "." (the JCR Self Notation) U+F02E
        ".." (the JCR Parent Notation) U+F02E and U+F02E
        Parameters:
        aJcrName - a name that should be escaped/encoded
        Returns:
        aJcrName escaped/encoded
        See Also:
        unEscapeJcrName(String)

      • unEscapeJcrName

        String unEscapeJcrName(String aJcrName)
        Unescapes/decodes a jcr name (property name or node name) that might be escape/encoded.

        Any operation that includes getting a JCR name must be unescaped if it contains illegal characters. For example: 

        
    javax.jcr.Node node = ...
    javax.jcr.Property property = ...

    java.lang.String aNameThatNeedsToBeUnEscaped = node.getName();
    java.lang.String anotherNameThatNeedsToBeUnEscaped = property.getName();

        See escapeJcrName(String) for escape/unescape characters and names

        Parameters:
        aJcrName - a name that might be escaped/encoded
        Returns:
        aJcrName unescaped/decoded
        See Also:
        escapeJcrName(String)

      • base64encode

        String base64encode(String aString)
        Encodes a string using base64 encoding (using UTF-8 encoding).
        Parameters:
        aString - a String that should be base64 encoded
        Returns:
        aString base64 encoded. Returns null if aString is null
        Since:
        Sitevision 2.6
        See Also:
        base64decode(String)

      • base64encodeToString

        String base64encodeToString(byte[] aBytes)
        Encodes a byte array to a base64 encoded string (using UTF-8 encoding).
        Parameters:
        aBytes - a byte array that should be base64 encoded as string
        Returns:
        aBytes as base64 encoded string, using UTF-8 encoding. Returns null if aBytes is null
        Since:
        Sitevision 4.5.5.2
        See Also:
        base64encode(String)

      • base64decode

        String base64decode(String aBase64EncodedString)
        Decodes a base64 encoded string (using UTF-8 encoding).
        Parameters:
        aBase64EncodedString - a base64 encoded String
        Returns:
        aBase64EncodedString base64 decoded. Returns null if aBase64EncodedString is null or can't be decoded.
        Since:
        Sitevision 2.6
        See Also:
        base64encode(String)

      • base64decodeToBytes

        byte[] base64decodeToBytes(String aBase64EncodedString)
        Decodes a base64 encoded string to a byte array (using UTF-8 encoding).
        Parameters:
        aBase64EncodedString - a base64 encoded String
        Returns:
        aBase64EncodedString base64 decoded as byte array, using UTF-8 encoding. Returns null if aBase64EncodedString is null or can't be decoded.
        Since:
        Sitevision 4.5.5.2
        See Also:
        base64decode(String)

      • escapeIdentifier

        String escapeIdentifier(String aPrefix,
                        String anIdentifier)
        Escapes/encodes an identifier.
        Some examples
        aPrefixanIdentifierReturned
        nullnull""
        ""null""
        null""""
        """"""
        "pcx"null"pcx"
        null"pcx""pcx"
        "pcx""""pcx"
        "pcx""123""pcx123"
        "pcx""1.23""pcx1_23"
        "pcx""1.23.45""pcx1_23_45"
        Parameters:
        aPrefix - a prefix added to the result
        anIdentifier - a string id
        Returns:
        a non-null prefixed and escaped string identifier
        Since:
        Sitevision 3.0.2
        See Also:
        unEscapeIdentifier(String, String)

      • unEscapeIdentifier

        String unEscapeIdentifier(String aPrefix,
                          String anIdentifier)
        Unescapes/decodes an escaped/encoded identifier.
        Some examples
        aPrefixanIdentifierReturned
        nullnull""
        ""null""
        null""""
        """"""
        "pcx"null""
        null"pcx""pcx"
        "pcx"""""
        "pcx""pcx123""123"
        "pcx""pcx1_23""1.23"
        "pcx""pcx1_23_45""1.23.45"
        null"pcx1_23""pcx1.23"
        """pcx1_23""pcx1.23"
        "badprefix""pcx1_23""pcx1.23"
        Parameters:
        aPrefix - a prefix that will be removed from the result
        anIdentifier - a string id
        Returns:
        an unescaped non-null identifier
        Since:
        Sitevision 3.0.2
        See Also:
        escapeIdentifier(String, String)

Sitevision - Portal and Content Management Made Easy
Sitevision is an advanced Java enterprise portal product and a portlet container (JSR 286) that implements Java Content Repository (JSR 283).
